intro: Senecio semperamatae, commonly known as the evergreen groundsel, is a member of the Asteraceae family and is native to South Africa. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is a low-growing perennial with a compact, mat-like form. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
